critique: This executive order establishes an Interdepartmental Committee on Narcotics to address issues related to drug enforcement, prevention, and treatment. It involves multiple federal departments and agencies, aiming to coordinate efforts and advise the President. There is no direct indication of a liberal or conservative ideological tilt. The order does not directly address immigration. It expands executive power by creating a committee and tasking it with advising the President and coordinating efforts across departments. It leans towards federal primacy by establishing a federal committee to address a national issue. It balances national security and civil liberties by focusing on drug enforcement while also addressing treatment and rehabilitation. It involves government intervention in addressing drug-related issues. It does not directly address social inclusion or conformity. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
